avalancheActivity.comment: The older wind slabs are mostly small and can be released by large loads in particular. They are rather rare and are easy to recognise.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The snowpack will be generally stable.

snowpackStructure.comment: Sunshine and high temperatures gave rise to rapid consolidation of the snowpack in all aspects. The older wind slabs are to be found on north facing slopes and generally at elevated altitudes. Field observations show the favourable bonding of the snowpack. In particular at low and intermediate altitudes hardly any snow is lying.

tendency.comment: Up to 15 cm of snow will fall in the late morning above approximately 1000 m. Strong northwesterly wind.

avalancheActivity.comment: The older wind slabs are rather small and unlikely to be released now.
avalancheActivity.highlights: From a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

snowpackStructure.comment: The snowpack will be subject to considerable local variations. Hardly any snow is lying above approximately 1600 m.
